quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Houston Astros and The Houston Astros
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, players. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first Houston Astros player ever to win the Rookie of the Year Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jeff Bagwell

questions.question: Bill Bradley held the record for most points scored in a NCAA tournament game until 1999.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which one of these players won an MVP Award while playing with the Houston Astros?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jeff Bagwell

questions.question: Who was the first baseball player to hit a home run in Minute Maid Park?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scott Rolen

questions.question: Already a permanent part of the American Basketball Association, the 3-point shot was instituted by the NBA in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: There were no teams inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame between 1961 and 2002.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: When was the first NBA Championship game played?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1947

questions.question: Which of these pitchers has won a Cy Young Award in 2004, while playing for the Houston Astros?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Clemens

questions.question: Oklahoma and Villanova played in the first Mens College Basketball final in 1939.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What former Houston Astros player was nicknamed The Toy Cannon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Wynn

questions.question: In his career, Nolan Ryan had 5,714 strikeouts. How many of them came while he played with the Houston Astros?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1866

questions.question: Who was the first Houston Astros player to be inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Morgan

questions.question: The inventor of basketball served in the Infantry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Mike Scott, a former pitcher in Major League Baseball, threw a no-hitter for the Houston Astros.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was the first Houston Astros Manager?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Craft

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Period and Year
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, committee, period. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: National Hockey League rules are slightly different from those used by the International Ice Hockey Federation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which 2 NHL teams faced off in a preseason game in London, England, in 1992?

options.text: Toronto Maple Leafs vs. Boston Bruins
Vancouver Canucks vs. Detroit Red Wings

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago Blackhawks vs. Montreal Canadians

questions.question: Who is the Conn Smythe Trophy awarded to every year?

options.text: The MVP for the regular season.
The MVP in the Stanley Cup Playoffs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The MVP in the Stanley Cup Playoffs

questions.question: Roughly how many television viewers watched the 2000 Olympic Games in Sydney, Australia over the whole course of the event?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3.8 billion

questions.question: The Stanley Cup Trophy has taken a ride on a roller coaster.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which were the first modern Olympic Games to be subject to a boycott by more than one country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1956, Melbourne

questions.question: 80% of the competitors in the 1904 Olympic games were from which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The USA

questions.question: The Beijing 2008 Olympic Games have been scheduled to include 28 sports and how many separate events?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 301-350

questions.question: Which of these womens names was not engraved on the Stanley Cup in the period from 2001-2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karen Hughes

questions.question: No Russians played in the NHL until the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what year was the longest overtime game in the Stanley Cup playoffs played, prior to the 2006/2007 seasons playoffs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1936

questions.question: During what period of time did the original Ottawa Senators franchise run?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1917-1934

questions.question: What was the Detroit Red Wings nickname from 1926 to 1930?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cougars

questions.question: Who was the 1st  European-born hockey player to be drafted first overall in the NHL entry draft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mats Sundin

questions.question: When was the International Olympic Committee founded?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1894

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Golfer and Golf
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athlete, jesse. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The New Jersey Devils have never won a Stanley Cup.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Jesse Orosco played shortstop for the New York Mets.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which professional golfer was known as The Hawk?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ben Hogan

questions.question: What is the home stadium of the New York Mets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shea Stadium

questions.question: This excellent amateur golfer who instituted his clambake at Rancho Santa Fe in San Diego died after a round of eighteen holes of golf in Madrid, Spain. His last words were reported as, That was a great game of golf, fellas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bing Crosby

questions.question: The Olympic Flame was introduced in 1928 and carrying it in a relay in the lead-up to each game began in 1936. Where in Greece is the flame lit at the start of the relay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Olympia

questions.question: The New York Yankees beat the Boston Red Sox in the 1986 World Series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these NBA teams is not in the Atlantic Division of the Eastern Conference?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miami

questions.question: In 1913, this young athlete became the first American-born golfer to win the US Open.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Ouimet

questions.question: Did David Wright play third baseman for the 2006 New York Mets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: A natural right-hander, this golfer plays left-handed, probably because he copied his fathers swing. He was the second left-handed golfer to win the Masters.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phil Mickelson

questions.question: Who was the first professional golfer to win all four professional major championships, known as a Career Grand Slam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gene Sarazen

questions.question: The Meadowland is the home ice of the NHLs New York Rangers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Members of which Olympic team were taken hostage by the terrorist group Black September during the 1972 Munich games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Israel

questions.question: The Olympic motto Citius, Altius, Fortius embodies the spirit of the Olympic movement. What is the English translation of these Latin words?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swifter, Higher, Stronger

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Home and Season
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, people, slugger. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Major Leaguer broke the career record for the most seasons with 40 or more home runs with 11 consecutive seasons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babe Ruth

questions.question: Which player held the record for the most consecutive 30 home run seasons in Major League history after the completion of the 2007 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Aaron

questions.question: After the 2007 season there were two people tied for the most games with 3 or more home runs in MLB history.  Which of the players listed below is a co-owner of that record?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sammy Sosa

questions.question: Which of the following catchers had the most home runs during his MLB career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Piazza

questions.question: Who is the only slugger in the following list that has had a 50+ home run season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andruw Jones

questions.question: Roger Maris home run record stood for 37 years until it was broken in 1998. Now his former single season record is not even in the top 5 of best home run seasons in Major League Baseball history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these baseball players did not lead the majors in home runs at least 3 consecutive years in a row?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Aaron

questions.question: All of the following players have at least 50 home runs in a season. Which one of these has the lowest overall career home run total?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Maris

questions.question: Who is the first major leaguer to hit two grand slams in the same inning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fernando Tatis

questions.question: What Major League Baseball slugger had the lowest average at-bats per home run ratio in his career for 2007? In other words, this mans at-bats have resulted in home runs more often than any other player in MLB history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark McGwire

questions.question: Upon the conclusion of the 2007 season, who held the Major League Baseball rookie record for most home runs hit in a season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark McGwire

questions.question: Which of the following players had NOT hit over 50 home runs in a single Major League Baseball season by the conclusion of the 2007 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carlos Delgado

questions.question: Which of these sluggers never hit for at least 40 home runs in a single MLB season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Carter

questions.question: Is a full count in baseball 2 balls and 2 strikes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Mike Hampton is listed in the top 5 of all-time for the most home runs by a pitcher in a major league career for 2007.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Home and Players
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, ruud, leaguers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following players has NOT hit over 50 home runs in a single MLB season?

options.text: All of them have accomplished this feat.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of them have accomplished this feat.

questions.question: Which one of the MLB players below has NOT hit at least 200 home runs in both the AL and the NL?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sammy Sosa

questions.question: Which one of the following baseball players led or co-led their league in home runs in the most consecutive years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ralph Kinner

questions.question: During the 1963-64 season, he set the United record for most goals in one season -- 46.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denis Law

questions.question: Which one of the following players reached the 200+ home run career mark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tim Wallach

questions.question: How many goals did Denis Law score during his 11 seasons with Manchester United?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 239

questions.question: How much did Manchester United pay PSV Eindhoven for Ruud Van Nistelrooy in 2001?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 19 million pounds

questions.question: Babe Ruth led the American League in home runs in three different decades.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following players did not hit 4 home runs in one game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babe Ruth

questions.question: Of the players listed below, who has the most career MLB home runs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sammy Sosa

questions.question: Several Major Leaguers have had multiple 50-plus home run seasons. Which player listed below has NOT accomplished this feat at least 3 times?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry Bonds

questions.question: Mark Bellhorn hit a home run from each side of the plate in a single inning.  Who is the other switch hitter to have accomplished this feat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carlos Baerga

questions.question: Only one of the combinations (player  - his 2003/2004 squad number) is correct, which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Solskjaer  - 20

questions.question: Which of the following Major League players has NOT had multiple seasons in which he hit 50 or more home runs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Gehrig

questions.question: Who scored a hat-trick when United trashed Southampton 6-1 i the 2001 premiership?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruud Van Nistelrooy

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Player and Baseball
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, brown, goslin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which baseball player became the first pitcher to throw 277 wild pitches?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nolan Ryan

questions.question: This man has the record achievement of over 14,000 Major League at-bats.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pete Rose

questions.question: Which was the first professional baseball player to hit at least 24 home runs while a still teenager?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Conigliaro

questions.question: This player became the first to hit into 350 double plays in a Major League baseball career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cal Ripken,  Jr.

questions.question: Tommy Brown broke the Major League record for the youngest person to hit a home run. How old was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 17 years, 2 months and 7 days

questions.question: In 1956, this city set a new record for the most fans at a baseball game - 114,000.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Melbourne

questions.question: Which baseball player became the first to hit at least 20 home runs in a month?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sammy Sosa

questions.question: From 1988-1989 this player set a new Major League record for most consecutive bases stolen without being thrown out.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vince Coleman

questions.question: He is the first baseball player to be caught stealing a base at least 355 times.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rickey Henderson

questions.question: Many pitchers have been great fielders. This man is the first pitcher to be involved in 94 double plays.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greg Maddux

questions.question: What talented NHL player, future Hall of Famer, held the record for longest-serving captain in 2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Yzerman

questions.question: He is the first baseball player to strike out at least 2,597 times.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reggie Jackson

questions.question: The National Womens Hockey League (NWHL) is the highest level of womens ice hockey in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Goose Goslin and this man are the only Major League baseball players to hit into 4 double plays in a single game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Torre

questions.question: In 1955 this baseball Hall of Famer broke the record for most consecutive times struck out.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sandy Koufax
